reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In this price range (up to 9000 yen a night), this is by far the best hotel we have stayed in so far in 8 days in Japan. The room was big enough for a double bed and ample room next to it for our bags. There was a tv, though we didn't check if there were English channels (probably not), kettle, hair dryer, trouser press in the hallway, and a large shelf along one wall which made a great desk for all our electricals. There was only a shower in our bathroom (and the usual toilet with lots of gadgets), but the rooftop onsen fulfilled any desire for a bath. The onsens are single sex, and the female side needs a special pass number to get into, which the man at reception gave me on check-in. The women's onsen was gorgeous, with an outdoor and indoor onsen as well as sauna and lots of shower cubicles. They also provided nice toiletries to use afterwards. My boyfriend tells me that the men's side was just as nice.
reviews.title: Great room and fab rooftop onsen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really liked the Dormy Inn and would stay here again if we came back through the area. It's less than 5 mins walk to the train station and 10 mins to Matsumoto castle, for those who like to double check proximity.
reviews.title: OK, but nothing special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012
reviews.text: We had originally booked into this hotel for 3 nights but on night one I decided to change it to 2 as I didn't really want to stay 3.
reviews.title: Overall a great place for a quick stopover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First off, let me say that this was comfortably the cheapest hotel we'd stayed at during our trip around Japan, but this did show in the size of the room and the quality of the hotel in general.
reviews.title: Nice place to drop in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In its favour, it was very well located, just 5 minutes walk to the station and about 5 to 10 minutes from the castle. It also had a very nice Onsen on the top floor, of which I wished I'd made better use.
reviews.title: Clean Hotel, Nice Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed for one night. Wish I stayed longer! Location is great - Close to the station, abundance of eateries, bus stop, etc. Amazing onsen! Went at night and once again in the morning before breakfast. So peaceful with the piped-in soft background music. I was alone both time. Thus, able to relax. The guest room is really nice and comfortable. Very modern with nice colour coordination. We reserved the Double Bedroom. The bed is large enough for two friends to share.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We bought the breakfast voucher for 1000Yen and it was really worth it! Loads to eat. Love the Onsen Egg. They also served Ramen at night but we didn't try.
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing I was slightly disappointed with was the lack of free wifi. However, there are two large PCs with extremely fast internet connection in the lobby.
reviews.title: Excellence in the Japan Alps

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: Had 6 nights at this lovely little hotel. Rooms clean and comfortable but quiet small Great breakfast and the desk staff very helpful very had limited english. However they used goggle translate when things got hard well done! Loved the free noodles at 930!Great location close to Matsumoto Castle and lots of great restaurants near by
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Matsumoto in the Japan Alps is a marvelously hospitable and beautiful place. And it was wonderful staying here in a very fine, indeed an excellent hotel. We were here four nights and all was very good.
reviews.title: impressed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel as it was supposed to be close to the Railway station and it is and certainly walking distance even with a Roller Case. The rooms are rather small as is the usual situation in most medium grade hotels in Japan.The bathroom especially is very small. However it has excellent hot spring on the rooftop as well as some indoor private and public hot spring baths. At night the rooftop onsen experience was great. The castle is walking distance from the hotel and the staff are helpful in directing you to the various sites.
reviews.title: The Rooftop Onsen makes it special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We chose this hotel based on tripadvisor recommendations. It's sort of the equivalent of a really clean and friendly Motel 6 in the U.S. The staff was very friendly and spoke English. They also had a handout of restaurants with English descriptions. It's a short walk to the castle. There's also a nice public onsen (gender seperated) on the top floor. And it was just over 10k yen. But do not expect much from the Dormy Inn. The rooms are very small and stark white. And you look out in the windows of an office building.
reviews.title: Spartan clean small friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's also a breakfast, but we opted for McDonald's, within an easy walk.
reviews.title: Top Recommendation - Worth Considering - Value and Position

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed 4 nights in October 2011 to visit and explore surrounding areas including Kiso Valley and Kamikochi areas.
reviews.title: Great service, convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: This is not a main steam tourist route so we picked a Dormy Inn as we had previously stayed in another of this chain hotels.
reviews.title: Good for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This was centrally located hotel, clean & modern, at Y10,000 (inc breakfast) for 2 persons + 800 parking, was good value. The size of the rooms is typical for Japan with very friendly staff. Breakfast buffet was surprisingly good and they even offered free bowl of ramen after 9:30 pm. The hotel has a good indoor bath and sauna for each sex.
reviews.title: Five stars for this great budget hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is in a good spot, clean, comfortable. It is a chain hotel - and nothing wrong with that! - and room was clean, comfortable and all ok. Free internet was also good. There was an option to get a free ramen for dinner but they also had a nice touch of a hand drawn map with recommended restaurants to go to (in english). There is a spa which is a major plus and would recommend to use that. Place is fine for a one or two night basic stay - but if you're looking for something more classy and upmarket - would suggest another place.
reviews.title: Solid and fit for purpose

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were not expecting much for 8,000 yen for a twin share business hotel, but were very pleasantly surprised with the size of the room and the overall presentation of the hotel.
reviews.title: Room size better than many business hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The decor is contemporary and very clean. There is a dining room on the ground floor that provides free meals later in the evening. Near reception are shelves with extra amenities eg. larger sized yukata etc. And the biggest surprise was the room size. There was the usual compact bathroom, but in addition there was a separate area with a basin and bar fridge and mirror. The twin beds were tucked inside a small alcove, but this allowed for more floor space for chairs, a bench where a laptop could be connected to high speed internet and more importantly somewhere to put our suitcases.
reviews.title: Very clean, modern/new, affordable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: On the top floor are separate mens and womens baths. Women are provided with a passcode to enter the womens area, offering a sense of security on what is otherwise a fairly isolated floor. There are laundry facilities provided in the bath area - 2 washing machines and dryers. Keys to access them are available from reception. This allows you to go back to your room to wait for it to finish, or alternatively you could try the hot baths. Although I didn't try them, they looked very enticing.
reviews.title: Everything ok! + free dinner!
